intro: Lysimachia rubiginosa var. ziguiensis, commonly known as the Zigui variegated lychnis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its striking variegated foliage with shades of green, white, and yellow. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
